event:
I've done a new podcast, for the website of the 2008 World Fantasy Convention in Calgary.  It can be found at 

http://worldfantasy2008.libsyn.com/

for those who are interested.

Elsewise?  Writing.  Gaming.  Editing.  

Oh, and we have a new kitten, an orange Maine Coon Cat, female.  So far she's the Kitten Without a Name, but we'll come up with one soon, I'm sure.  She's a great hit with me and Parris, but Caligula is less than pleased at the presence of another cat in the house, and he hisses and spits whenever he sees her.  So

comments.article: Aw. Kittens! Wish we could have them over the house. Much luck with the new addition in the family, and I hope the kittens gets along eventually with Caligula.

*facepalm*

I meant kitten. Guh.
Congratulations on the new kitten!
Saw pictures of the kitten on Parris' blog.  Cute!
Parris has a Blog? Do you have a link?

Gah. You can't talk about kittens and not post pics! Especially an orange kitten. I have a huge soft spot for orange cats, which is why I have possession of a feisty little orange rescue named Floribunda.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: ethelclose
comments.article: Mz. Thang is gorgeous, and Caligula will fall to her wiles (read: ginormous fluffy tail) soon enough.
Good luck with the new kitten!  I'm glad I'm not the only one who names a pet "Caligula"!  I once had a Doberman named Caligula--she was a female and the sweetest dog you could ever hope to meet.
If Caligula dislikes the kitten, then obviously her name is Agrippina.
A Maine Coon?  Those you address as "Your Majesty" and "Ma'am".
Name her Drusilla, that should soften up Caligula. :)
I've seen her on Parris' LJ. I agree with Drusilla or Agrippina.... though that will shorten to pet names soon enough.
comments.subject: She's truly a cutie

comments.article:
We tend to give more attention to the cute little kitten, so make a point of giving as much or more attention to Caligula when she is around. He will see that she wont take his place in the house and he should soften...

The only thing you have to watch out for is his stress level, cats cant handle stress very well.

Good Luck with the new lady in the house!
But what about THE WIRE? Tonight was the finale. THE WIRE is over. :(

Orange cats are the best.
What color eyes does she have? My Tiger has some wicked yellow ones.
I also have an orange (or a Red and Silver to be technical), Maine Coon.  He's the gorgeous beast in my user picture.  MC's are fantastic cats, good luck with her!

comments.upictitle: s t a r l e t: moi
comments.article: Congratulations on your new little one! May you have much joy of her.

comments.upictitle: A Very Friendly Asshole: NEVER FORGET
comments.article: I want a Maine Coon so badly. Those cats are ginormous.

comments.upictitle: in search of a clever byline: ETC - Vonnegut
comments.article: Congrats on the new family member. My newest, Stingo, is nearly 1.5 and is just *now* learning how to play with the dog ('cause the old man won't have any of his kitten crap), 'tho he finally stopped hissing at her a few months ago.
Maine Coons are the Best Cats Ever. I should know. I have two of them. :) Congrats on the new addition.

Interesting podcast! Thanks for posting the link.

Congrats on the new baby. I hope Caligula adjusts to his new house mate quickly.

would it be too nerdy to name the new cat Chaerea, or even Cassius Chaerea (the guy who killed Caligula)? Or possibly after Caligula's successor, Claudius, though I'll grant that's not nearly as cool a name as Chaerea.
Ok, that's even nerdier than Drusilla. :-)

comments.upictitle: bojojoti: CatLOLcat-Time to smack a duck by mystic
comments.article: Congratulations on the new kitten.  May Caligula go from spitting to ignoring in short order.

(see my user pic) yes, she is the most beautiful girl cat in the ever expanding universe. Wish I had had the foresight to take a picture of her half brother, Jesse. He was winning every ribbon he was eligible for, and deserved them. Not quite two years old, and he was truly ginormous. She got the oversized fluffy paws, lynx tips of a classic Maine Coon.

Having a new kitten for the first time in 12 years? Absolutely delightful.
comments.subject: red cuteness

comments.article: Kittens!!! I have five at the moment! And one is orange! Our stray we adopted had babies. Anyone want one? (And live in Australia?) Congrats on the new addition, I love fluffy kittens!
comments.subject: Re: red cuteness

comments.article:
I appreciate all the suggestions, many of them very cool, but Parris insists that this time it's her turn to name the cat, since I named Augustus (Gus) and Caligula (Boots). I've suggested Drusilla, Agrippina, Livia Augusta, Valeria Messalina, and other great choices, and she has vetoed them all.

And Claw-Claw-Claudius is the name for a mail cat, of course. But we need to get a Tiberius in there first. Our friends John and Gail already have a Nero, though they insist he's named after the detective, not the emperor.

Next time, we need a Savannah cat named Hannibal.
comments.subject: naming the kitten

comments.article:
"a mail cat"

Is there something I should know about the Post Office?
comments.subject: Re: naming the kitten

comments.upictitle: J.A.C.K. Inc.  Super Secret Ninja Force: Flutterby
comments.article: Awwww, kitty!  :D

Naming pets can be interesting... my college girlfriend showed up in my room at the fraternity house with a new kitten one day. She didn't know what to name it. I was less than interested in the cat at the time than the freshly cleaned shower stall in our shared suite bathroom... so I showed her my exciting news. She asked how my suite-mate Patrick had managed to get it so clean and I responded that he used Comet. Instantly I told her she should name the cat Comet. It stuck and long story short, the only good thing I got out of that relationship was a black cat named Comet.

So while looking for fancy schmancy historical names, never neglect the common household cleaning goods!
comments.subject: Cat name
